results.title: ‘Vortex’ Review: A Split Screen and a Shared Fate
results.abstract: Gaspar Noé’s new film chronicles the decline of an elderly couple in remorseless, mesmerizing detail.

multimedia.caption: Lebrun and Argento in the film. Her character seems to have Alzheimer’s, and infirmity has taken a toll on the couple.
Lebrun and Argento in the film. Her character seems to have Alzheimer’s, and infirmity has taken a toll on the couple.
Lebrun and Argento in the film. Her character seems to have Alzheimer’s, and infirmity has taken a toll on the couple.

results.title: It Took Me 40 Years to Watch the Movie ‘Diva.’ It Was Worth the Wait.
results.abstract: At a friend’s urging, our critic saw the “mondo chic” 1981 film by the French director Jean-Jacques Beineix, ahead of a revival. He was thrilled.

multimedia.caption: Wilhelmenia Fernandez portrays an opera singer in “Diva,” from 1981, which was directed by Jean-Jacques Beineix.
Wilhelmenia Fernandez portrays an opera singer in “Diva,” from 1981, which was directed by Jean-Jacques Beineix.
Wilhelmenia Fernandez portrays an opera singer in “Diva,” from 1981, which was directed by Jean-Jacques Beineix.

results.title: Stream These Three Great Documentaries
results.abstract: This month’s nonfiction picks include one about uncovering a treasure trove of silent films and one that aims to uncover the methods of Kenny G.

multimedia.caption: Louise Lovely in “The Social Buccaneer,” one of hundreds of silent films that were buried in Dawson City, Yukon, and discovered decades later. They are the subject of the documentary “Dawson City: Frozen Time.”
multimedia.copyright: Dawson City Museum, Library and Archives Canada, and the Library of Congress/Kino Lorber

results.title: In Films and on TV, a New Openness to Natural Black Hairstyles
results.abstract: The relationship between characters and their Afro-textured hair has become a focus of directors and stylists, who are mindful of Hollywood’s restrictive past.

multimedia.caption: From top, Marsai Martin in “black-ish,” Zazie Beetz in “The Harder They Fall,” Issa Rae in “Insecure” and KiKi Layne in “Coming 2 America.”
multimedia.copyright: ABC (“black-ish”); Netflix (“The Harder They Fall”); HBO (“Insecure”); Paramount Pictures (“Coming 2 America”)

results.title: ‘Anaïs in Love’ Review: Portrait of a Woman on the Run
results.abstract: A restless woman discovers herself in a seductive French romance that throws out the usual dusty script about women, desire and pleasure.

multimedia.caption: Valeria Bruni Tedeschi, left, and Anaïs Demoustier in “Anaïs in Love,” the feature debut of Charline Bourgeois-Tacquet.
Valeria Bruni Tedeschi, left, and Anaïs Demoustier in “Anaïs in Love,” the feature debut of Charline Bourgeois-Tacquet.
Valeria Bruni Tedeschi, left, and Anaïs Demoustier in “Anaïs in Love,” the feature debut of Charline Bourgeois-Tacquet.

results.title: An Heir, a $25 Million Giveaway and 30,000 Unopened Letters
results.abstract: In 1970, Michael James Brody Jr. announced he would give away his fortune to anyone who asked. The letters he received are a time capsule of the setting of the Age of Aquarius.

multimedia.caption: “It’s very, very unusual to get everyday people’s stories into the archives in a way like this, with thousands of people writing and talking about their lives at one moment in time,” said Thai Jones, a curator at Columbia.
multimedia.copyright: Vincent Tullo for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: “It’s very, very unusual to get everyday people’s stories into the archives in a way like this, with thousands of people writing and talking about their lives at one moment in time,” said Thai Jones, a curator at Columbia.
multimedia.copyright: Vincent Tullo for The New York Times

results.title: ‘The Survivor’ Review: Clenched Fists
results.abstract: In this drama from Barry Levinson, Ben Foster plays a Jewish boxer who, during the Holocaust, was forced to fight his fellow Jews for the Nazis’ entertainment.

multimedia.caption: Ben Foster, right, with Vicky Krieps in “The Survivor.”
Ben Foster, right, with Vicky Krieps in “The Survivor.”
Ben Foster, right, with Vicky Krieps in “The Survivor.”

results.title: ‘The Mystery of Marilyn Monroe: The Unheard Tapes’ Review: Gossip Girl
results.abstract: This documentary teases a vague conspiracy surrounding Monroe’s death — but mostly rehashes well-circulated facts and rumors.
des_facet: The Mystery of Marilyn Monroe: The Unheard Tapes (Movie)

multimedia.caption: Marilyn Monroe, the subject of the documentary “The Mystery of Marilyn Monroe: The Unheard Tapes.”

results.title: ‘Hatching’ Review: The Best-Laid Plans
results.abstract: Scrambling creature feature with psycho-horror, this inventive oddity brings tween anxieties to monstrous life.

multimedia.caption: Siiri Solalinna in “Hatching.”
Siiri Solalinna in “Hatching.”
Siiri Solalinna in “Hatching.”

results.title: Jacques Perrin, French Film Star and Producer, Dies at 80
results.abstract: He was a heartthrob in the musical “The Young Girls of Rochefort,” a photojournalist in the thriller “Z,” and later a world-weary director in the hit “Cinema Paradiso.”

multimedia.caption: A weeping Jacques Perrin in the closing scene of “Cinema Paradiso” (1988), his film best known to American audiences.
A weeping Jacques Perrin in the closing scene of “Cinema Paradiso” (1988), his film best known to American audiences.
A weeping Jacques Perrin in the closing scene of “Cinema Paradiso” (1988), his film best known to American audiences.

results.title: Five Horror Movies to Stream Now
results.abstract: This month’s picks include demented cultists, zombies with pause buttons, hellish stays at a hotel, an unsettling home share and a killer named Oopsie.

multimedia.caption: Paula Silva in “Virus-32.”
Paula Silva in “Virus-32.”
Paula Silva in “Virus-32.”

results.title: In Echo of Soviet Era, Russia’s Movie Theaters Turn to Pirate Screenings
results.abstract: In a Cold War throwback, some venues are showing bootleg versions after Hollywood studios pulled films from the country. Still, viewer numbers have tanked.

multimedia.caption: The Oktyabr movie theater in Moscow. Ticket sales to see films in Russia were reported to have fallen by about half in March, compared with the same period last year.
The Oktyabr movie theater in Moscow. Ticket sales to see films in Russia were reported to have fallen by about half in March, compared with the same period last year.
The Oktyabr movie theater in Moscow. Ticket sales to see films in Russia were reported to have fallen by about half in March, compared with the same period last year.

results.title: Watch Alexander Skarsgard Battle the Undead in ‘The Northman’
results.abstract: The director Robert Eggers narrates a scene that pits the star against a most unfriendly zombie.

results.title: Where’d All the Method Acting Go?
results.abstract: The Method taught actors to channel the complexity and messiness of human emotion into a performance. Why is that so hard to find in the movies today?
results.byline: By Wesley Morris, Elyssa Dudley, Hans Buetow and Sasha Weiss

results.title: ‘Crush’ Review: A Banksy Who Might Shred Homework
results.abstract: A mysterious artist and a love triangle are at the center of this high-school comedy, which can’t quite decide whether to be preposterous or sincere.

multimedia.caption: Rowan Blanchard in “Crush.”

results.title: ‘Bad Roads’ Review: A Wartime Anthology
results.abstract: The movie, with its four vignettes about Ukraine, was the country’s submission for best international feature film for the Oscars.

results.title: ‘Hello, Bookstore’ Review: A Bibliophile and His Shop in Close-Up
results.abstract: This documentary makes it clear why, when the pandemic threatened Matthew Tannenbaum’s store, book lovers weren’t ready to say goodbye.

results.abstract: In this clandestine romance, a Soviet soldier and pilot find love while stationed in Estonia in the 1970s.

results.abstract: The determinedly uplifting comedy follows a 50-year-old French filmmaker as she dates in Los Angeles.

results.title: ‘Memory’ Review: Getting Too Old for This
results.abstract: In this action thriller, Liam Neeson plays an assassin struggling with Alzheimer’s disease. It’s not as interesting as it sounds.

results.title: ‘Fiddler’s Journey to the Big Screen’ Review: Making a New Tradition
results.abstract: Daniel Raim’s admiring documentary uses interviews and movie clips to detail the making of Norman Jewison’s beloved movie musical.

results.title: ‘Africa’ Review: Aging and its Discontents

results.title: Reconsidering the Spice Girls: How Manufactured Girl Power Became Real
results.abstract: Even as the girl group topped the charts, it was dismissed as a pop confection. Twenty-five years later, its legacy is still being written.
results.byline: By Alisha Haridasani Gupta and Jennifer Harlan

results.title: The Sheryl Crow You Never Knew
results.abstract: For decades, the singer-songwriter carved her own path while battling sexism in the music industry and personal darkness. Now, at 60, she’s telling her story in a new documentary.

multimedia.copyright: Peyton Fulford for The New York Times
Peyton Fulford for The New York Times

results.title: Kenneth Tsang, Veteran Hong Kong Actor, Dies at 87
results.abstract: Mr. Tsang, who was known for tough-guy supporting roles and ubiquitous hair dye advertisements, was found dead while in hotel quarantine.

multimedia.caption: Kenneth Tsang with the best supporting actor award for his role in “Overheard 3” at the Hong Kong Film Awards in 2015.
Kenneth Tsang with the best supporting actor award for his role in “Overheard 3” at the Hong Kong Film Awards in 2015.

results.title: Review: Billy Crystal Carries the Tune in ‘Mr. Saturday Night’
results.abstract: In a mishmash new musical based on his 1992 movie, he charms the audience as a has-been comic reconnecting with family.

multimedia.caption: Billy Crystal as Buddy Young Jr., trying to get laughs out of a crowd of senior citizens, in the new musical “Mr. Saturday Night” at the Nederlander Theater.
Billy Crystal as Buddy Young Jr., trying to get laughs out of a crowd of senior citizens, in the new musical “Mr. Saturday Night” at the Nederlander Theater.

results.title: ‘A Black Lady Sketch Show’ Has the Most Exciting Comics (and the Silliest)
results.abstract: Robin Thede and her castmates bring a light, joyful touch and a comedy-nerd sensibility to this HBO series that often, delightfully, descends into the absurd.

results.title: A Boxer at Auschwitz and the Pain He Carried
results.abstract: Ordered to win fights or be put to death, Harry Haft, the subject of a new film, was haunted by the fates of his opponents.

results.title: Sarah Silverman’s Family Show (Really!) About Divorce and Depression
results.abstract: “Everything’s couched with hard jokes, but it’s also vulnerable,” the comic said of “The Bedwetter,” her new musical comedy.

results.title: Criminal Charges Still Possible in ‘Rust’ Shooting, Sheriff Says
results.abstract: Newly released evidence shows the leads investigators pursued as they try to learn how a live round got into Alec Baldwin’s gun, which fired, killing the film’s cinematographer.
results.byline: By Julia Jacobs and Graham Bowley

multimedia.caption: The cinematographer Halyna Hutchins was shot dead Oct. 21 on the set of “Rust” when a revolver Alec Baldwin was practicing with turned out to contain a live round.
The cinematographer Halyna Hutchins was shot dead Oct. 21 on the set of “Rust” when a revolver Alec Baldwin was practicing with turned out to contain a live round.
The cinematographer Halyna Hutchins was shot dead Oct. 21 on the set of “Rust” when a revolver Alec Baldwin was practicing with turned out to contain a live round.

results.title: ‘Rust’ Investigators Release Crime Scene Photos, Await Key Evidence
results.abstract: The criminal investigation of Alec Baldwin’s fatal shooting of a cinematographer on a film set cannot be completed without key ballistics and other evidence, the Santa Fe County sheriff said.
results.byline: By Graham Bowley and Julia Jacobs
